p: Two oligosaccharides can be formed depending on the moiety of end sugar, namely, agaro-oligosaccharides and neoagaro-oligosaccharides [ 77]. Neoagarobiose, α- l-3,6-anhydro- l-galactosyl-(1→3)-β- d-galactopyranose, is the basic unit of neoagarooligosaccharides. Neoagarooligosaccha-rides were found to be safe up to 5000 mg/kg body weight in acute oral toxicity tests with rat and beagle dog models [ 45].
